curam.util.persistence.validation.customizable
Class AbstractValidator

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.persistence.validation.customizable.AbstractValidator

public abstract class AbstractValidator
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract validator ("Mixin") providing validators and helper methods for validation.

Validator interface implementations can extend this class. They are then able to invoke the accessor methods that it declares in order to obtain instances of validator helper classes. They can also invoke the AbstractValidator.isEnabled(ValidationContext) method to check whether or not a particular validation is enabled, and the AbstractValidator.failValidation(AppException) method in order to mark a validation as failed.

failValidation

protected AppException failValidation(AppException appException)
Signal that the validation has failed. This simply passes the supplied AppException through to the PI ValidationHelper.addValidationError(AppException) method.

Parameters:
appException - The validation error exception object.
Returns:
The appException instance.

isEnabled

protected boolean isEnabled(ValidationContext ctx)
Return a boolean indicating whether or not the validation with the supplied context is enabled.

Parameters:
ctx - The ValidationContext to check.
Returns:
Boolean indicating whether or not the context is enabled.
